page.title: 12Cheriton Fitz Education
page.content: There is a{Primary School for about 70 children, aged 5 to 11 with a lively Parent/Teachers Association. The building is an ancient, thatched, former Poorhouse, extensively modernised within. At 11+ the children go by school bus to Queen Elizabeth's {Comprehensive {School}in Crediton. A few parents send their children to{independent} preparatory and former "Direct Grant" schools in Exeter and Tiverton, including a very few boarders. In{1925}and earlier the village school took all ages, 5 to 14, with some infants even younger. Parents who sent their children (on bicycles) to the Boys' or Girls' High Schools in Crediton paid 4 guineas a term. In{1905}the headmaster ran some evening classes for adults.
